00034 %locations
00035 
00036 /* supress shift-reduces conflict message for dangling else */
00037 /* one for 'if', one for 'uif' */
00038 %expect 2
00039 
00040 %pure-parser
00041 
00042 %code requires {
00043 
00044 #define YYLTYPE SourcePos
00045 
00046 # define YYLLOC_DEFAULT(Current, Rhs, N)                               \
00047     do                                                                 \
00048       if (N)                                                           \
00049         {                                                              \
00050           (Current).first_line   = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 1).first_line;       \
00051           (Current).first_column = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 1).first_column;     \
00052           (Current).last_line    = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, N).last_line;        \
00053           (Current).last_column  = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, N).last_column;      \
00054           (Current).name         = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 1).name    ;         \
00055         }                                                              \
00056       else                                                             \
00057         { /* empty RHS */                                              \
00058           (Current).first_line   = (Current).last_line   =             \
00059             YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 0).last_line;                               \
00060           (Current).first_column = (Current).last_column =             \
00061             YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 0).last_column;                             \
00062           (Current).name = NULL;                        /* new */ \
00063         }                                                              \
00064     while (0)
00065 }

00096 static const char *lGetStorageClassString(StorageClass sc);

00134 %token TOKEN_IDENTIFIER TOKEN_INT_CONSTANT TOKEN_UINT_CONSTANT TOKEN_FLOAT_CONSTANT

00138 %token TOKEN_AND_OP TOKEN_OR_OP TOKEN_MUL_ASSIGN TOKEN_DIV_ASSIGN TOKEN_MOD_ASSIGN

00188 %start translation_unit
00189 %%
00190 
00191 string_constant
00192     : TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL { $$ = new std::string(*yylval.stringVal); }
00193     ;
00194 
00195 primary_expression
00196     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER {
00197         const char *name = yylval.stringVal->c_str();
00198         Symbol *s = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable(name);
00199         $$ = NULL;
00200         if (s)
00201             $$ = new SymbolExpr(s, @1);       
00202         else {
00203             std::vector<Symbol *> *funs = m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(name);
00204             if (funs)
00205                 $$ = new FunctionSymbolExpr(funs, @1);
00206         }
00207         if ($$ == NULL) {
00208             std::vector<std::string> alternates = 
00209                 m->symbolTable->ClosestVariableOrFunctionMatch(name);
00210             std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
00211             Error(@1, "Undeclared symbol \"%s\".%s", name, alts.c_str());
00212         }
00213     }
00214     | TOKEN_INT_CONSTANT {
00215         /* FIXME: should support 64 bit constants (and doubles...) */
00216         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstInt32, yylval.int32Val, @1); 
00217     }
00218     | TOKEN_UINT_CONSTANT {
00219         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32, yylval.uint32Val, @1); 
00220     }
00221     | TOKEN_FLOAT_CONSTANT {
00222         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstFloat, (float)yylval.floatVal, @1); 
00223     }
00224     | TOKEN_TRUE {
00225         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstBool, true, @1);
00226     }
00227     | TOKEN_FALSE {
00228         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstBool, false, @1);
00229     }
00230 /*    | TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL
00231        { UNIMPLEMENTED }*/
00232     | '(' expression ')' { $$ = $2; }
00233     ;
00234 
00235 postfix_expression
00236     : primary_expression
00237     | postfix_expression '[' expression ']'
00238       { $$ = new IndexExpr($1, $3, @1); }
00239     | postfix_expression '(' ')'
00240       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($1, new ExprList(@1), @1, false); }
00241     | postfix_expression '(' argument_expression_list ')'
00242       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($1, $3, @1, false); }
00243     | TOKEN_LAUNCH '<' postfix_expression '(' argument_expression_list ')' '>'
00244       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($3, $5, @3, true); }
00245     | TOKEN_LAUNCH '<' postfix_expression '(' ')' '>'
00246       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($3, new ExprList(@3), @3, true); }
00247     | postfix_expression '.' TOKEN_IDENTIFIER
00248       { $$ = new MemberExpr($1, yytext, @1, @3); }
00249 /*    | postfix_expression TOKEN_PTR_OP TOKEN_IDENTIFIER
00250       { UNIMPLEMENTED }
00251 */
00252     | postfix_expression TOKEN_INC_OP
00253       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PostInc, $1, @1); }
00254     | postfix_expression TOKEN_DEC_OP
00255       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PostDec, $1, @1); }
00256     ;
00257 
00258 argument_expression_list
00259     : assignment_expression      { $$ = new ExprList($1, @1); }
00260     | argument_expression_list ',' assignment_expression
00261       {
00262           ExprList *argList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>($1);
00263           assert(argList != NULL);
00264           argList->exprs.push_back($3);
00265           $$ = argList;
00266       }
00267     ;
00268 
00269 unary_expression
00270     : postfix_expression
00271     | TOKEN_INC_OP unary_expression   
00272       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PreInc, $2, @2); }
00273     | TOKEN_DEC_OP unary_expression   
00274       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PreDec, $2, @2); }
00275     | '+' cast_expression 
00276       { $$ = $2; }
00277     | '-' cast_expression 
00278       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::Negate, $2, @2); }
00279     | '~' cast_expression 
00280       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::BitNot, $2, @2); }
00281     | '!' cast_expression 
00282       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::LogicalNot, $2, @2); }
00283     ;
00284 
00285 cast_expression
00286     : unary_expression
00287     | '(' type_name ')' cast_expression
00288       {
00289           // If type_name isn't explicitly a varying, We do a GetUniform() 
00290           // call here so that things like:
00291           // uniform int y = ...;
00292           // uniform float x = 1. / (float)y;
00293           // don't issue an error due to (float)y being inadvertently
00294           // and undesirably-to-the-user "varying"...
00295           if ($4->GetType()->IsUniformType())
00296              $2 = $2->GetAsUniformType();
00297           $$ = new TypeCastExpr($2, $4, @1); 
00298       }
00299     ;
00300 
00301 multiplicative_expression
00302     : cast_expression
00303     | multiplicative_expression '*' cast_expression
00304       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Mul, $1, $3, @2); }
00305     | multiplicative_expression '/' cast_expression
00306       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Div, $1, $3, @2); }
00307     | multiplicative_expression '%' cast_expression
00308       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Mod, $1, $3, @2); }
00309     ;
00310 
00311 additive_expression
00312     : multiplicative_expression
00313     | additive_expression '+' multiplicative_expression
00314       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Add, $1, $3, @2); }
00315     | additive_expression '-' multiplicative_expression
00316       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Sub, $1, $3, @2); }
00317     ;
00318 
00319 shift_expression
00320     : additive_expression
00321     | shift_expression TOKEN_LEFT_OP additive_expression
00322       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Shl, $1, $3, @1); }
00323     | shift_expression TOKEN_RIGHT_OP additive_expression
00324       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Shr, $1, $3, @1); }
00325     ;
00326 
00327 relational_expression
00328     : shift_expression
00329     | relational_expression '<' shift_expression
00330       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Lt, $1, $3, @2); }
00331     | relational_expression '>' shift_expression
00332       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Gt, $1, $3, @2); }
00333     | relational_expression TOKEN_LE_OP shift_expression
00334       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Le, $1, $3, @2); }
00335     | relational_expression TOKEN_GE_OP shift_expression
00336       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Ge, $1, $3, @2); }
00337     ;
00338 
00339 equality_expression
00340     : relational_expression
00341     | equality_expression TOKEN_EQ_OP relational_expression
00342       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Equal, $1, $3, @2); }
00343     | equality_expression TOKEN_NE_OP relational_expression
00344       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, $1, $3, @2); }
00345     ;
00346 
00347 and_expression
00348     : equality_expression
00349     | and_expression '&' equality_expression
00350       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, $1, $3, @2); }
00351     ;
00352 
00353 exclusive_or_expression
00354     : and_expression
00355     | exclusive_or_expression '^' and_expression
00356       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::BitXor, $1, $3, @2); }
00357     ;
00358 
00359 inclusive_or_expression
00360     : exclusive_or_expression
00361     | inclusive_or_expression '|' exclusive_or_expression
00362       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::BitOr, $1, $3, @2); }
00363     ;
00364 
00365 logical_and_expression
00366     : inclusive_or_expression
00367     | logical_and_expression TOKEN_AND_OP inclusive_or_expression
00368       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, $1, $3, @2); }
00369     ;
00370 
00371 logical_or_expression
00372     : logical_and_expression
00373     | logical_or_expression TOKEN_OR_OP logical_and_expression
00374       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, $1, $3, @2); }
00375     ;
00376 
00377 conditional_expression
00378     : logical_or_expression
00379     | logical_or_expression '?' expression ':' conditional_expression
00380       { $$ = new SelectExpr($1, $3, $5, @1); }
00381     ;
00382 
00383 assignment_expression
00384     : conditional_expression
00385     | unary_expression '=' assignment_expression
00386       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::Assign, $1, $3, @2); }
00387     | unary_expression TOKEN_MUL_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00388       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::MulAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00389     | unary_expression TOKEN_DIV_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00390       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::DivAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00391     | unary_expression TOKEN_MOD_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00392       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::ModAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00393     | unary_expression TOKEN_ADD_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00394       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::AddAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00395     | unary_expression TOKEN_SUB_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00396       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::SubAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00397     | unary_expression TOKEN_LEFT_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00398       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::ShlAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00399     | unary_expression TOKEN_RIGHT_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00400       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::ShrAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00401     | unary_expression TOKEN_AND_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00402       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::AndAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00403     | unary_expression TOKEN_XOR_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00404       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::XorAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00405     | unary_expression TOKEN_OR_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00406       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::OrAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00407     ;
00408 
00409 expression
00410     : assignment_expression
00411     | TOKEN_SYNC 
00412       { $$ = new SyncExpr(@1); }
00413     | expression ',' assignment_expression
00414       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Comma, $1, $3, @2); }
00415     ;
00416 
00417 constant_expression
00418     : conditional_expression
00419     ;
00420 
00421 declaration_statement
00422     : declaration     { $$ = new DeclStmt(@1, $1, m->symbolTable); }
00423     ;
00424 
00425 declaration
00426     : declaration_specifiers ';'
00427       {
00428           $$ = new Declaration($1);
00429       }
00430     | declaration_specifiers init_declarator_list ';'
00431       {
00432           $$ = new Declaration($1, $2);
00433       }
00434     ;
00435 
00436 soa_width_specifier
00437     : TOKEN_SOA '<' int_constant '>'
00438       { $$ = $3; }
00439     ;
00440 
00441 declaration_specifiers
00442     : storage_class_specifier
00443       {
00444           $$ = new DeclSpecs(NULL, $1);
00445       }
00446     | storage_class_specifier declaration_specifiers
00447       {
00448           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00449           if (ds->storageClass != SC_NONE)
00450               Error(@1, "Multiple storage class specifiers in a declaration are illegal. "
00451                     "(Have provided both \"%s\" and \"%s\".)",
00452                     lGetStorageClassString(ds->storageClass),
00453                     lGetStorageClassString($1));
00454           else
00455               ds->storageClass = $1;
00456           $$ = ds;
00457       }
00458     | soa_width_specifier
00459       {
00460           DeclSpecs *ds = new DeclSpecs;
00461           ds->soaWidth = $1;
00462           $$ = ds;
00463       }
00464     | soa_width_specifier declaration_specifiers
00465       {
00466           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00467           if (ds->soaWidth != 0)
00468               Error(@1, "soa<> qualifier supplied multiple times in declaration.");
00469           else
00470               ds->soaWidth = $1;
00471           $$ = ds;
00472       }
00473     | type_specifier
00474       {
00475           $$ = new DeclSpecs($1);
00476       }
00477     | type_specifier '<' int_constant '>'
00478     {
00479           DeclSpecs *ds = new DeclSpecs($1);
00480           ds->vectorSize = $3;
00481           $$ = ds;
00482     }
00483     | type_specifier declaration_specifiers
00484       {
00485           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00486           if (ds->baseType != NULL)
00487               Error(@1, "Multiple types provided for declaration.");
00488           ds->baseType = $1;
00489           $$ = ds;
00490       }
00491     | type_qualifier
00492       {
00493           $$ = new DeclSpecs(NULL, SC_NONE, $1);
00494       }
00495     | type_qualifier declaration_specifiers
00496       {
00497           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00498           ds->typeQualifier |= $1;
00499           $$ = ds;
00500       }
00501     ;
00502 
00503 init_declarator_list
00504     : init_declarator
00505       {
00506           std::vector<Declarator *> *dl = new std::vector<Declarator *>;
00507           dl->push_back($1);
00508           $$ = dl;
00509       }
00510     | init_declarator_list ',' init_declarator
00511       {
00512           std::vector<Declarator *> *dl = (std::vector<Declarator *> *)$1;
00513           dl->push_back($3);
00514           $$ = $1;
00515       }
00516     ;
00517 
00518 init_declarator
00519     : declarator
00520     | declarator '=' initializer { $1->initExpr = $3; $$ = $1; }
00521     ;
00522 
00523 storage_class_specifier
00524     : TOKEN_TYPEDEF { $$ = SC_TYPEDEF; }
00525     | TOKEN_EXTERN { $$ = SC_EXTERN; }
00526     | TOKEN_EXTERN TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL  { 
00527           if (*(yylval.stringVal) != "C")
00528               Error(@2, "String constant \"%s\" illegal after \"extern\" qualifier.  "
00529                     "(Expected \"C\".)", yylval.stringVal->c_str());
00530           $$ = SC_EXTERN_C; 
00531       }
00532     | TOKEN_EXPORT { $$ = SC_EXPORT; }
00533     | TOKEN_STATIC { $$ = SC_STATIC; }
00534     ;
00535 
00536 type_specifier
00537     : TOKEN_VOID { $$ = AtomicType::Void; }
00538     | TOKEN_BOOL { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingBool; }
00539 /*    | TOKEN_CHAR { UNIMPLEMENTED; } */
00540     | TOKEN_INT { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingInt32; }
00541     | TOKEN_FLOAT { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingFloat; }
00542     | TOKEN_DOUBLE { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingDouble; }
00543     | TOKEN_INT64 { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingInt64; }
00544     | TOKEN_TYPE_NAME
00545       { const Type *t = m->symbolTable->LookupType(yytext); 
00546         assert(t != NULL);
00547         $$ = t;
00548       }
00549     | struct_or_union_specifier { $$ = $1; }
00550     | enum_specifier 
00551       { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
00552 /*    | TOKEN_TYPE_NAME 
00553       { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
00554 */
00555     ;
00556 
00557 struct_or_union_name
00558     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER { $$ = strdup(yytext); }
00559     | TOKEN_TYPE_NAME { $$ = strdup(yytext); }
00560     ;
00561 
00562 struct_or_union_specifier
00563     : struct_or_union struct_or_union_name '{' struct_declaration_list '}' 
00564       { 
00565           std::vector<const Type *> elementTypes;
00566           std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
00567           std::vector<SourcePos> elementPositions;
00568           GetStructTypesNamesPositions(*$4, &elementTypes, &elementNames,
00569                                        &elementPositions);
00570           StructType *st = new StructType($2, elementTypes, elementNames,
00571                                           elementPositions, false, true, @2);
00572           m->symbolTable->AddType($2, st, @2);
00573           $$ = st;
00574       }
00575     | struct_or_union '{' struct_declaration_list '}' 
00576       {
00577           std::vector<const Type *> elementTypes;
00578           std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
00579           std::vector<SourcePos> elementPositions;
00580           GetStructTypesNamesPositions(*$3, &elementTypes, &elementNames,
00581                                        &elementPositions);
00582           $$ = new StructType("", elementTypes, elementNames, elementPositions,
00583                               false, true, @1);
00584       }
00585     | struct_or_union '{' '}' 
00586       {
00587           Error(@1, "Empty struct definitions not allowed."); 
00588       }
00589     | struct_or_union struct_or_union_name '{' '}' 
00590       {
00591           Error(@1, "Empty struct definitions not allowed."); 
00592       }
00593     | struct_or_union struct_or_union_name
00594       { const Type *st = m->symbolTable->LookupType($2); 
00595         if (!st) {
00596             std::vector<std::string> alternates = m->symbolTable->ClosestTypeMatch($2);
00597             std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
00598             Error(@2, "Struct type \"%s\" unknown.%s", $2, alts.c_str());
00599         }
00600         else if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(st) == NULL)
00601             Error(@2, "Type \"%s\" is not a struct type!", $2);
00602         $$ = st;
00603       }
00604     ;
00605 
00606 struct_or_union
00607     : TOKEN_STRUCT 
00608     ;
00609 
00610 struct_declaration_list
00611     : struct_declaration 
00612       { 
00613           std::vector<StructDeclaration *> *sdl = new std::vector<StructDeclaration *>;
00614           sdl->push_back($1);
00615           $$ = sdl;
00616       }
00617     | struct_declaration_list struct_declaration 
00618       {
00619           std::vector<StructDeclaration *> *sdl = (std::vector<StructDeclaration *> *)$1;
00620           sdl->push_back($2);
00621           $$ = $1;
00622       }
00623     ;
00624 
00625 struct_declaration
00626     : specifier_qualifier_list struct_declarator_list ';' 
00627       { $$ = new StructDeclaration($1, $2); }
00628     ;
00629 
00630 specifier_qualifier_list
00631     : type_specifier specifier_qualifier_list
00632     | type_specifier
00633     | type_qualifier specifier_qualifier_list 
00634     {
00635         if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM)
00636             $$ = $2->GetAsUniformType();
00637         else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_VARYING)
00638             $$ = $2->GetAsVaryingType();
00639         else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE)
00640             $$ = new ReferenceType($2, false);
00641         else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_CONST)
00642             $$ = $2->GetAsConstType();
00643         else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED) {
00644             const Type *t = $2->GetAsUnsignedType();
00645             if (t)
00646                 $$ = t;
00647             else {
00648                 Error(@1, "Can't apply \"unsigned\" qualifier to \"%s\" type. Ignoring.",
00649                       $2->GetString().c_str());
00650                 $$ = $2;
00651             }
00652         } 
00653         else {
00654             UNIMPLEMENTED;
00655         }
00656     }
00657 /* K&R--implicit int type--e.g. "static foo" -> foo is an int */
00658 /*    | type_qualifier { UNIMPLEMENTED; }*/
00659     ;
00660 
00661 
00662 struct_declarator_list
00663     : struct_declarator 
00664       {
00665           std::vector<Declarator *> *sdl = new std::vector<Declarator *>;
00666           sdl->push_back($1);
00667           $$ = sdl;
00668       }
00669     | struct_declarator_list ',' struct_declarator 
00670       {
00671           std::vector<Declarator *> *sdl = (std::vector<Declarator *> *)$1;
00672           sdl->push_back($3);
00673           $$ = $1;
00674       }
00675     ;

00707     | TOKEN_UNIFORM    { $$ = TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM; }

00709     | TOKEN_TASK       { $$ = TYPEQUAL_TASK; }
00710     | TOKEN_INLINE     { $$ = TYPEQUAL_INLINE; }

00723 direct_declarator
00724     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER
00725       {
00726           Symbol *sym = new Symbol(yytext, @1);
00727           $$ = new Declarator(sym, @1);
00728       }
00729     | '(' declarator ')' { $$ = $2; }
00730     | direct_declarator '[' constant_expression ']'
00731     {
00732         Expr *size = $3;
00733         if (size) size = size->TypeCheck();
00734         if (size) {
00735             size = size->Optimize();
00736             llvm::Constant *cval = size->GetConstant(size->GetType());
00737             if (!cval) {
00738                 Error(@3, "Array dimension must be compile-time constant");
00739                 $$ = NULL;
00740             }
00741             else {
00742                 llvm::ConstantInt *ci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(cval);
00743                 if (!ci) {
00744                     Error(@3, "Array dimension must be compile-time integer constant.");
00745                     $$ = NULL;
00746                 }
00747                 $1->AddArrayDimension((int)ci->getZExtValue());
00748                 $$ = $1;
00749             }
00750         }
00751         else
00752             $$ = NULL;
00753     }
00754     | direct_declarator '[' ']'
00755     {
00756         $1->AddArrayDimension(-1); // unsized
00757         $$ = $1;
00758     }
00759     | direct_declarator '(' parameter_type_list ')'
00760       {
00761           Declarator *d = (Declarator *)$1;
00762           d->isFunction = true;
00763           d->functionArgs = $3;
00764           $$ = d;
00765       }
00766 /* K&R?   | direct_declarator '(' identifier_list ')' */
00767     | direct_declarator '(' ')'
00768       {
00769           Declarator *d = (Declarator *)$1;
00770           d->isFunction = true;
00771           $$ = d;
00772       }
00773     ;
00774

00776 parameter_type_list
00777     : parameter_list { $$ = $1; }
00778     ;

00786     }
00787     | parameter_list ',' parameter_declaration
00788     {
00789         std::vector<Declaration *> *dl = (std::vector<Declaration *> *)$1;
00790         dl->push_back($3);
00791         $$ = dl;
00792     }
00793     ;

00804 
00805     }

00919       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, $7, false, @1); }
00920     | TOKEN_CIF '(' expression ')' statement
00921       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, NULL, true, @1); }

00923       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, $7, true, @1); }

00948 iteration_statement
00949     : TOKEN_WHILE '(' expression ')' statement
00950       { $$ = new ForStmt(NULL, $3, NULL, $5, false, @1); }
00951     | TOKEN_CWHILE '(' expression ')' statement
00952       { $$ = new ForStmt(NULL, $3, NULL, $5, true, @1); }
00953     | TOKEN_DO statement TOKEN_WHILE '(' expression ')' ';'
00954       { $$ = new DoStmt($5, $2, false, @1); }
00955     | TOKEN_CDO statement TOKEN_WHILE '(' expression ')' ';'
00956       { $$ = new DoStmt($5, $2, true, @1); }

00958       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, NULL, $6, false, @1); 
00959         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
00960       }
00961     | for_scope '(' for_init_statement for_test expression ')' statement
00962       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, new ExprStmt($5, @5), $7, false, @1); 
00963         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
00964       }

00966       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, NULL, $6, true, @1);
00967         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
00968       }

00970       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, new ExprStmt($5, @5), $7, true, @1);
00971         m->symbolTable->PopScope();

00979       { $$ = new ContinueStmt(false, @1); }
00980     | TOKEN_BREAK ';'
00981       { $$ = new BreakStmt(false, @1); }
00982     | TOKEN_RETURN ';'
00983       { $$ = new ReturnStmt(NULL, false, @1); }

00998       {

01000       }

01006 
01007 translation_unit
01008     : external_declaration
01009     | translation_unit external_declaration
01010     | error
01011     {
01012         std::vector<std::string> builtinTokens;
01013         const char **token = lBuiltinTokens;
01014         while (*token) {
01015             builtinTokens.push_back(*token);
01016             ++token;
01017         }
01018         std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(yytext, builtinTokens);
01019         std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
01020         Error(@1, "Syntax error--token \"%s\" unknown.%s", yytext, alts.c_str());
01021     }
01022     ;
01023 
01024 external_declaration
01025     : function_definition
01026     | TOKEN_EXTERN TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL '{' declaration '}' // FIXME: make sure string=="C"
01027     | declaration 
01028     { 
01029         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < $1->declarators.size(); ++i)
01030             m->AddGlobal($1->declSpecs, $1->declarators[i]);
01031     }
01032     ;
01033 
01034 function_definition
01035     : declaration_specifiers declarator 
01036     {
01037         m->AddGlobal($1, $2);
01038         lAddFunctionParams($2); 
01039         lAddMaskToSymbolTable(@2);
01040         if ($1->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK)
01041             lAddThreadIndexCountToSymbolTable(@2);
01042     } 
01043     compound_statement
01044     {
01045         m->AddFunction($1, $2, $4);
01046         m->symbolTable->PopScope(); // push in lAddFunctionParams();
01047     }
01048 /* function with no declared return type??
01049 func(...) 
01050     | declarator { lAddFunctionParams($1); } compound_statement
01051     {
01052         m->AddFunction(new DeclSpecs(, $1, $3);
01053         m->symbolTable->PopScope(); // push in lAddFunctionParams();
01054     }
01055 */
01056     ;
01057 
01058 %%
01059 
01060 
01061 /** We're about to start parsing the body of a function; add all of the
01062     parameters to the symbol table so that they're available.
01063 */
01064 static void
01065 lAddFunctionParams(Declarator *decl) {
01066     m->symbolTable->PushScope();
01067 
01068     // wire up arguments
01069     if (decl->functionArgs) {
01070         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < decl->functionArgs->size(); ++i) {
01071             Declaration *pdecl = (*decl->functionArgs)[i];
01072             assert(pdecl->declarators.size() == 1);
01073             Symbol *sym = pdecl->declarators[0]->sym;
01074 #ifndef NDEBUG
01075             bool ok = m->symbolTable->AddVariable(sym);
01076             assert(ok); // or error message?
01077 #else
01078             m->symbolTable->AddVariable(sym);
01079 #endif
01080         }
01081     }
01082 
01083     // The corresponding pop scope happens in function_definition rules
01084     // above...
01085 }
01086 
01087 
01088 /** Add a symbol for the built-in mask variable to the symbol table */
01089 static void lAddMaskToSymbolTable(SourcePos pos) {
01090     const Type *t = AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32;
01091     Symbol *maskSymbol = new Symbol("__mask", pos, t);
01092     m->symbolTable->AddVariable(maskSymbol);
01093 }
01094 
01095 
01096 /** Add the thread index and thread count variables to the symbol table
01097     (this should only be done for 'task'-qualified functions. */
01098 static void lAddThreadIndexCountToSymbolTable(SourcePos pos) {
01099     Symbol *threadIndexSym = new Symbol("threadIndex", pos, AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32);
01100     m->symbolTable->AddVariable(threadIndexSym);
01101 
01102     Symbol *threadCountSym = new Symbol("threadCount", pos, AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32);
01103     m->symbolTable->AddVariable(threadCountSym);
01104 }
01105 
01106 
01107 /** Small utility routine to construct a string for error messages that
01108     suggests alternate tokens for possibly-misspelled ones... */
01109 static std::string lGetAlternates(std::vector<std::string> &alternates) {
01110     std::string alts;
01111     if (alternates.size()) {
01112         alts += " Did you mean ";
01113         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
01114             alts += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
01115             if (i < alternates.size() - 1) alts += ", or ";
01116         }
01117         alts += "?";
01118     }
01119     return alts;
01120 }
01121 
01122 static const char *
01123 lGetStorageClassString(StorageClass sc) {
01124     switch (sc) {
01125     case SC_NONE:
01126         return "";
01127     case SC_EXTERN:
01128         return "extern";
01129     case SC_EXPORT:
01130         return "export";
01131     case SC_STATIC:
01132         return "static";
01133     case SC_TYPEDEF:
01134         return "typedef";
01135     case SC_EXTERN_C:
01136         return "extern \"C\"";
01137     default:
01138         assert(!"logic error in lGetStorageClassString()");
01139         return "";
01140     }
01141 }
